page.title: 09GRESHAM SCHOOL
page.content: Some of us from Lillington First School went to visit Gresham School. Mr Sturley the Head teacher told us that children from Leamington and all the villages to the East can go to Gresham if they find the work too hard in their ordinary schools. There are about 100 children aged from 6 to 16 and they can start at any age between 6 and 9. Each class has about 13 children and they do lots of nice things like cooking, carpentry and table tennis as well as lessons like ours. They go camping at weekends, also canoeing and rock climbing. They go on lots of school trips, don't wear a uniform and come to school on a mini-bus. It's a really nice school.
